author: Reuters Editorial
description: U.S. President Donald Trump told South Korea's presidential envoy that Washington was willing to resolve the North Korean nuclear crisis through engagement under the right conditions, South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported on Thursday.
title: Trump willing to use engagement on North Korea crisis: South Korea envoy

author: Claire Reid
description: His comments come after North Korea launched a successful test missile on Sunday.
title: US Admiral Calls North Korea's Actions A 'Recipe For Disaster' | LADbible

description: TOKYO (AP) — The top American military officer in the Pacific says North Korea's recent military actions are "a recipe for a disaster" and is warning against a sense of complacency in the face of increasing tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
title: US admiral: North Korea's actions 'recipe for disaster'

author: Narae Kim
description: Investors may be glued to the latest political turmoil in Washington, but there’s a long-present danger that’s now looming larger for some analysts: North Korea.
title: Trump Aside, It May Be Time for Markets to Worry About North Korea

author: John Hayward
description: North Korea has been working on a patent for producing sodium cyanide, which can be used in nerve gas, with the help of a U.N. agency.
title: Report: U.N. Agency Is Helping North Korea with Patent for Nerve Gas Component

author: John Hayward
description: On Wednesday, South Korean President Moon Jae-in said “there is a high possibility of a military conflict” with North Korea.
title: South Korean President Moon: ‘High Possibility’ of Military Conflict with North Korea - Breitbart

author: Michelle Nichols
description: North Korea's deputy United Nations envoy said on Friday "it is ridiculous" to link Pyongyang with the WannaCry "ransomware" cyber attack that started to sweep around the globe a week ago or the hacking of a U.N. expert monitoring sanctions violations.
title: North Korea says linking cyber attacks to Pyongyang is 'ridiculous'

author: https://www.facebook.com/annafifield
description: North Korea tells its people terrible things about what the American forces did during the Korean War. And it's not all wrong.
title: Analysis | Why does North Korea hate the United States? Let’s go back to the Korean War.

author: Nyshka Chandran
description: Pricier smartphones and higher U.S. federal debt are among the key consequences from a potential war against North Korea, according to a Capital Economics.
title: War with North Korea could increase smartphone prices, disrupt global trade and widen US debt

author: http://www.abc.net.au/news/michael-collett/166910
description: There's been a lot of focus on North Korea's nuclear ambitions. But what can be lost in the discussion is just how powerful the country's military already is.
title: How much damage could North Korea unleash even without nuclear weapons?
